track.name: Algorithms
track.descriptions: The true test of problem solving: when one realizes that time and memory aren't infinite.

primary_contest.description: Our mission is to close the gender gap in computer science. Joining Women's CodeSprint 3 gives women an opportunity to showcase formidable female skill by solving real-world coding challenges, to win $11,000 in cash prizes and to get discovered by sponsoring companies looking to hire.
primary_contest.name: Women's CodeSprint 3

model.python3_template:
#!/bin/python3

import sys

def solve(n, s, d, m):
    # Complete this function

n = int(input().strip())
s = list(map(int, input().strip().split(' ')))
d, m = input().strip().split(' ')
d, m = [int(d), int(m)]
result = solve(n, s, d, m)
print(result)
model.name: Birthday Chocolate
model.php_template:
<?php

$handle = fopen ("php://stdin", "r");
function solve($n, $s, $d, $m){
    // Complete this function
}

fscanf($handle, "%d",$n);
$s_temp = fgets($handle);
$s = explode(" ",$s_temp);
$s = array_map('intval', $s);
fscanf($handle, "%d %d", $d, $m);
$result = solve($n, $s, $d, $m);
echo $result . "\n";

?>
model.python_template:
#!/bin/python

import sys

def solve(n, s, d, m):
    # Complete this function

n = int(raw_input().strip())
s = map(int, raw_input().strip().split(' '))
d, m = raw_input().strip().split(' ')
d, m = [int(d), int(m)]
result = solve(n, s, d, m)
print(result)
model.ruby_template:
#!/bin/ruby

def solve(n, s, d, m)
    # Complete this function
end

n = gets.strip.to_i
s = gets.strip
s = s.split(' ').map(&:to_i)
d, m = gets.strip.split(' ')
d = d.to_i
m = m.to_i
result = solve(n, s, d, m)
puts result;
model.haskell_template:
import Control.Applicative
import Control.Monad
import System.IO


main :: IO ()
main = do
    n_temp <- getLine
    let n = read n_temp :: Int
    s_temp <- getLine
    let s = map read $ words s_temp :: [Int]
    d_temp <- getLine
    let d_t = words d_temp
    let d = read $ d_t!!0 :: Int
    let m = read $ d_t!!1 :: Int

getMultipleLines :: Int -> IO [String]

getMultipleLines n
    | n <= 0 = return []
    | otherwise = do          
        x <- getLine         
        xs <- getMultipleLines (n-1)    
        let ret = (x:xs)    
        return ret
model.preview: Given an array of integers, find the number of subarrays of length k having sum s.
model.clojure_template:
(use '[clojure.string :only (split triml)])

(
        let [
          n_t (read-line) 
          n (Integer/parseInt n_t) 
        ]

      (
        let [
          s_temp (read-line) 
          s_t (split s_temp #"\s+") 
          s (map #(Integer/parseInt %) s_t) 
        ]
      )

      (
        let [
          d_temp (read-line) 
          d_t (split d_temp #"\s+") 
          d (Integer/parseInt (d_t 0)) 
          m (Integer/parseInt (d_t 1)) 
        ]
      )

)
model.erlang_template:
-module(solution).
-export([main/0]).

main() ->

    { ok, [N]} = io:fread("", "~d"),
    S = read_array(N,"~d"),
    { ok, [D,M]} = io:fread("", "~d~d"),
    true.

read_array(0,D) -> [];
read_array(N,D) -> 
	{ok, [X]} = io:fread("", D),
	[X | read_array(N-1,D)].

read_2darray(0,M,D) -> [];
read_2darray(N,M,D) ->
	Q=read_array(M,D),
	[Q | read_2darray(N-1,M,D)].
model.lua_template:
function solve(n, s, d, m)
    -- Complete this function

n = io.read("*number", "*l")
s = {}
s_temp = io.read()
s_i = 1;
for token in string.gmatch(s_temp, "[^%s]+") do
	s[s_i] = token
	s_i = s_i + 1
end
d,m = io.read("*number", "*number", "*l")
